comment: Don't take this class if you want to learn the real thing. The professor often chats in class. No exam and presentation. No grade feedback throughout the semester, only one result at the end of the semester.
If you have other pro. for this course, do not have Goldstein's class. You really do not know what he is talking in class and his books. Terrible. It is really hard for you to get a good score

Likes to pretend hes tough, but hes really not. He enjoys what he does and has a lot of experience in the field. Has some great stories and is a great connection to have. He is slightly a difficult grader when it comes to his test. Not really clear on what he expects from the test. The test is also usually short essay questions
Very knowledgeable professor, always incorporates a lot of cool stories when explains material. Also, always willing to answer student's questions and overall helpful

Although he is an informative professor, he sometimes discussed some highly inappropriate things, which made me cringe in my seat. I would think twice before taking him again, even though when it came to the test and studying it was pretty easy.
Great professor. Maybe at the beginning you are confused but that's exactly the point of his class...It's all about complexity and change! New theories that help you to become a great leader!
I LUV this professor
Very, very, very confusing and vague teacher... however, not sure if that was the point of the course. Project at end of the class was very confusing as well. Easy grader though...
Interesting guy, likes to incorporate a lot of anectdotes in his classes. Definitely worth taking as a professor.
Love this man!
Interesting class topics presented by Prof. Mercurio. He is extremely helpful to his students and cares a lot about them. He is willing to work with the student which is a great quality.
Very nice and helpful professor. For Art & Craft of Writing he lets you rewrite essays for a better grade, but it's still a lot of reading and writing. I would take class with him again.

Very smart, very caring, but learned little in the actual course. Took three classes with him and the only class I learned anything in was UNHUMAN CONDITION. Would not take him again. The pace is not conducive to true discussion. Asks for discussion but often dismisses what you say if it's not what he's trying to get you to say. Overrated prof.

Prof Mercurio wants discussion in class but does little to actually facilitate it. Often discounts the statements you make. Has interesting standpoints and can bring up valuable information. But overall, learned little.
great guy. i wasn't that interested in the material of the course but he did a great job teaching it.
Great professor, genuinely a good guy and always willing to help. I had my interview with him for the honors college, and he's the reason I came to Adelphi. I only wish he taught more classes

I honestly cannot think of anything bad to say about Prof. Mercurio! He cares very much about his students and is very helpful with papers or anything a student does not understand. He is one the best professors at Adelphi. I strongly recommend him. The only thing is that because he's so good, his classes fill up quickly.
great great great
Have had him as a professor for many classes and is always a wonderful learning experience. Funny, intelligent man, with a lot of interest in his students' well being.
Lots of discussion and only one paper - always willing to listen and accepts variety of perspective!
Greg Rocks... yeah Bingo
No Comments
Great teacher. Always nice and cheerful.  Never misses an opportunity to say hi
an absolute genius! one of the most interesting people i've ever met, be prepared to use your mind in totally new ways
